# üî≠ Distributed Tracing with Tempo

Traces are collected via OpenTelemetry and stored in Grafana Tempo.

## üëâ [Click here to Search Traces in Explore](/explore?schemaVersion=1&panes=%7B%22v1b%22%3A%7B%22datasource%22%3A%22tempo%22%2C%22queries%22%3A%5B%7B%22refId%22%3A%22A%22%2C%22datasource%22%3A%7B%22type%22%3A%22tempo%22%2C%22uid%22%3A%22tempo%22%7D%2C%22queryType%22%3A%22traceqlSearch%22%2C%22limit%22%3A20%7D%5D%2C%22range%22%3A%7B%22from%22%3A%22now-1h%22%2C%22to%22%3A%22now%22%7D%7D%7D&orgId=1)

The **Explore** view provides the best experience for:
- Searching traces by service, duration, status
- Viewing trace timelines and span details
- Correlating traces with logs

## üì° OTLP Endpoints

Send traces to these endpoints:

| Protocol | Endpoint |
|----------|----------|
| **gRPC** | `<oib-host>:4317` |
| **HTTP** | `http://<oib-host>:4318` |

Replace `<oib-host>` with your OIB server IP/hostname.

## üîß App Configuration

Set these environment variables:

```bash
export OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT=http://<oib-host>:4318
export OTEL_SERVICE_NAME=my-service
```

For Docker containers on oib-network:
```bash
OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT=http://oib-alloy-telemetry:4317
```

## üêç Python Example

```python
from opentelemetry import trace
from opentelemetry.sdk.trace import TracerProvider
from opentelemetry.sdk.trace.export import BatchSpanProcessor
from opentelemetry.exporter.otlp.proto.grpc.trace_exporter import OTLPSpanExporter

# Set up the tracer provider
provider = TracerProvider()
exporter = OTLPSpanExporter(
    endpoint="oib-alloy-telemetry:4317",
    insecure=True
)
provider.add_span_processor(BatchSpanProcessor(exporter))
trace.set_tracer_provider(provider)

# Get a tracer and create spans
tracer = trace.get_tracer(__name__)

with tracer.start_as_current_span("my-operation") as span:
    span.set_attribute("key", "value")
    # Your code here
```

üìÅ See `examples/python-flask` for complete example
